content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 17 Nov 2018RSP non-payment penalties?For Regular Savings Plans , do you had to commit a minimum sum for each monthly installment? so lets say if I am cash tight for a particular month or had other ideas to deploy the money to other financial instrument(s), would I be penalized by RSP-brokerage provider?2 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (2)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 18 Nov 2018For maybank ke, which I'm currently using, the minimum is 100 monthly, and you can choose to stop its continuation via their online portal 0 comments0

Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 17 Nov 2018You'll need to invest minimum $100 monthly 1. RSP will be terminated automatically after 3 consecutive failed RSP deductions. An email will be sent to notify the investors of the voided RSP 2. POSB only reminded to have sufficient funds and did not mention about penalty, so i guess there's none for NIKKO AM 3.1 https://www.dbs.com.sg/personal/ibanking/faq/rsp.page2 https://www.fundsupermart.com/fsm/advice-services/faq/8720/3 https://www.posb.com.sg/personal/investments/investing-in-funds/invest-saver0 comments0
